oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Climate smart dairy and beef
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mitloehner, Frank M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: production efficiency
inputs
outputs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Production efficiency in the dairy and beef industry canbe defined as minimizing the amount of inputs (e.g., feed, fossil fuels) and outputs (e.g., ammonia, NH3; greenhouse gases, GHG) to produce a given quantity of milk or meat. The present paper will focus on the dairy example. Production efficiency improvements can come from minimizing waste, maximizing a dairy cowâ€™s milk production, and maximizing the proportion of her life spent in peak milk production without sacrificing animal health and well-being.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019; 177-181
